title: FOR HONOR

title: FOR HONOR
review:
I'm only 6 hours in to the game, but I will say I don't see what's with the mixed reviews. The game has strategic mechanics to create a little realism into how you strike/defend and maybe that is why.

But for those who like a challenge and actual realism, not just who pressed the button first to slash, then give it a go.

The tutorial explains the basics of the mechanics, which is enough to get you started. But realistically, you'll just pick it up along the way. Highly recommend paying attention and completing the tutorial though. It will save you a lot of pain down the line.
If you're heading into multiplayer, it might be worth doing some duels/brawls alongside, just so that you can focus on the actual duel as opposed to dealing with 3rd parties jumping in too.

I'll definitely be playing this some more.
Graphics are great on Ultra setting with 1440p monitor.

I like the options for multiplayer. from Sieges to 2v2's and 1v1's - its pretty nice.

I checked out the storyline within these first 6 hours (by literally spending 5.75 hrs in multiplayer and for the last 15 mins I completed the first story mission. There are nice cutscenes, the animations are done well, and just based on that first playthrough alone, there is quite a grabbing storyline too, which makes me want to play some more!

I bought it while it was on sale - it's definitely worth a try if:
- You want a game with a more realistic approach to sword-fighting within a game. (and understand that this means more challenge, patience and learning).
- Enjoy Vikings, Knights and Samurais
- Not the type to throw your keyboard/controller and say it is because the enemy is "clearly cheating".

And finally: For those who are curious about the online population of the game. Namely in the larger game mode:

The Sieges (Breach as they are called in the game) are only 4v4, but there are NPC's which fill out the map. So I wouldn't worry about how active the game is for a good siege! The NPC's have been incorporated into the game quite nicely. You're not just another dude in the war. The NPC's are. your way of achieving the goals in the game mode are different to what theirs are! Having them though definitely adds to the game. I actually think its better this way than 20v20 online players. With this sort of mechanism for the fighting, that would be pure hell!

I'm only 6 hours in to the game, but I will say I don't see what's with the mixed reviews. The game has strategic mechanics to create a little realism into how you strike/defend and maybe that is why.

But for those who like a challenge and actual realism, not just who pressed the button first to slash, then give it a go.

The tutorial explains the basics of the mechanics, which is enough to get you started. But realistically, you'll just pick it up along the way. Highly recommend paying attention and completing the tutorial though. It will save you a lot of pain down the line.
If you're heading into multiplayer, it might be worth doing some duels/brawls alongside, just so that you can focus on the actual duel as opposed to dealing with 3rd parties jumping in too.

I'll definitely be playing this some more.
Graphics are great on Ultra setting with 1440p monitor.

I like the options for multiplayer. from Sieges to 2v2's and 1v1's - its pretty nice.

I checked out the storyline within these first 6 hours (by literally spending 5.75 hrs in multiplayer and for the last 15 mins I completed the first story mission. I bought it while it was on sale - it's definitely worth a try if:

- Enjoy Vikings, Knights and Samurais
- Not the type to throw your keyboard/controller and say it is because the enemy is "clearly cheating".

P.S. Finally, for those who are curious about the online population of the game. Namely in the larger game mode:

The Sieges (Breach as they are called in the game) are only 4v4, but there are NPC's which fill out the map. So I wouldn't worry about how active the game is for a good siege! The NPC's have been incorporated into the game quite nicely. You're not just another dude in the war. The NPC's are. your way of achieving the goals in the game mode are different to what theirs are! Having them though definitely adds to the game. I actually think its better this way than 20v20 online players. With this sort of mechanism for the fighting, that would be pure hell!

title: FOR HONOR
review: Listen. Imma keep it real with all of you who is reading this. The concept of the game is not bad and the game-play itself is one of a kind, hell it has the potential to be the best of it's kind (Swordplay) but the overall mechanics and balance of the game is trash. First thing first, The majority of the people who play this game are Viking lovers, so that faction gets the most upgrades and buffs of all kinds, while everyone else gets Nerf. Now I play the samurai faction, Orochi (a samurai hero) who literally gets Nerf after every patch, for really no reason at all while OP characters continuously gets buffs. It's crazy. Here's an example of the unfair balance, Berserker, a viking character, gets hyper armor with every attack (including light attacks) despite not having no armor at all. Shaman (a viking hero with a dagger with one hand and a hand axe in the other) inflicts more damage than characters who are wielding full size swords with two hands. Hitokiri ( who is a samurai hero, but has a western weapon called the Double-sided war axe,) swings faster than most characters and does tons of damage on top of that, and does a ridiculous one shot back flip move while you're getting jump by other players. I can go on and on but imma stop there, and i'm pretty decent at the game so it's not like i don't know what i'm talking about I get wins in almost every game, but facts is just facts. Anyways, I hope this helps. All love and peace.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
Not casual/new player friendly. Unbalanced in most regards, therefore the only way to enjoy yourself is to bludgeon yourself until you lack feeling or sweat your balls off to try and be the best (you'll still hate yourself). The original experience is tarnished by the lack of depth/cheap tricks added with new heroes. 

In short, you either buy/earn the high tier characters or suffer.

IF you buy, you WILL uninstall and reinstall the game at least 5 times before you realise its probably not a good idea to give it another go. That's a sweet UBISOFT guarantee for you!

Better off just leaving this one on the wish-list lads, you'll thank me later. 
(unless you wish for the unending peril to your mental health that this game offers, in which case, be my guest... you masochist...).

title: FOR HONOR
review: The skill base match making system that is in this game is terrible. I come back to this game after 2 years off and I win 2 matches then they place you in duels with Rep 200+ and it keeps you there for the whole time you're playing. Not a fun/fair game at all. HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE WARNING!!!

title: FOR HONOR
review:
This game was advertised as a well animated medieval combat game with a fantastical world of Vikings, Knight and Samurais.


It has since been turned into an overwatch clone, adding characters and new factions that break the entire theme of the game while making the new characters have crazy combo's that don't make sense (Like cancelling a leaping attack) or just have a bunch of Unblockable attacks/grabs


Just go get Mordhau or Chivalry 2 or Mount and Blade.

title: FOR HONOR
review: Campaign is ok, but multiplayer, not so great. Like someone said "This game is like Fentanyl, it feels good in minor doses but if you take to much you will kill yourself." - S3RKT

title: FOR HONOR
review:
This game is an abusive relationship. On paper it is a very good idea, A sword fighting PVP game with unique classes, completely customisable characters, and a war map that constantly changes? that sounds awesome! and you would be right. 

However, it becomes less fun when 1) you have to pay money for a battlepass, for a game you already spent money on 2) not all the characters are unlocked when you get the game and the newest character is always overtuned and the only way to get them is to either A) grind the game like your like depends on it or B) spend 10$ to get the character instantly for a game you have already spent money on. 

Not to mention that this game is INSANELY difficult for new players to join as this community is probably one of if not THE sweatiest game ever.

So TLDR if you want to buy a cool sword fighting game with PVP, just look away from this one.

title: FOR HONOR
review: This game is unique, one of its kind but its not really a good game. The dev aren't properly working on it and ubisoft is totally a failure.  I wish they gave this game to someone else like the devs from Wukong or Cyberpunk. It could be an amazing game.

title: FOR HONOR
review: It is baffling how close to good this game is. The devs have no idea what they are doing for the most part, just making small adjustments here and there while addressing none of the games major problems. Most of the feats should have been removed year one and the fact that you can get one shot by multiple off screen attacks is all that is needed to prove that JC and the gang should have been fired years ago. Everyone on the competitive balancing side of the team needs to be let go as soon as possible.

title: FOR HONOR
review: an advanced version of rock, paper, scissors. I played this on ps4 when it first came out and quit after a few weeks because the servers kept disconnecting people when they were 15 minutes into a 20 minute match. and its still happening. And on top of that, the games been out for 5 years, so the only people playing it now are the sweaty try-hards and the people that just never tried it before. it leads to a pretty big skill-diff in matches. note: I am not saying that I'm good at this game, quite the opposite, but there isn't any real motivation to invest time in it.

The revenge system is completely awful if one teammate hits the person your are fighting they will get revenge. Learning a new character is pointless because you will either get double teamed or fight someone that abuses stupid mechanics like bleed. If you want mental problems this is your game. :)

Also why can you bleed while in revenge.

title: FOR HONOR

title: FOR HONOR
review:
Gameplay is awesome, very deep, very high skill ceiling, very fun when you win. But as solid as the gameplay is I dont think it can carry the game forever with the dogshit management Ubisoft is putting out here. 

 Budget is probably not even a fraction of the flops after flops Ubisoft has been releasing so content updates are basically low quality animations and reskinned outfits. Balance updates are very scarce so problematic characters stay the same for a very long time. As a Ubisoft special servers suck dick so expect atleast 1 person from either team to disconnect every game and pray its not on your team so you dont have to play a very hard to win match for no reason. 

 Speaking of winning, there is no reason to 'want to win' other than for the sake of it because only one mode (1v1) has ranked and it is practically dead. Nobody plays ranked so you either wait a 5 to 10 min queue for a very unbalanced match or just play normals for fun forever.

 With all these taken into consideration, it is hard to recommend the game, which is a shame really because the core gameplay is very unique and fun.

title: FOR HONOR
review: For Honor is pretty dope, especially with its compelling campaign with plenty of loot to obtain to play in the base game. In year 8, For Honor gives new players access to each main faction's four original warriors of the Vanguard (Balanced), Assassin (Attacker/Damage-Dealer), Heavy (Tank), and Hybrid (Mixed/Unique Gameplay) characters, with the exception of the Wu Lin who give only their vanguard and assassin classes, and the "Miscellaneous" Outlanders faction of just all hybrids so far. As for gameplay, you have two large-scale modes of 4v4 with minions, and smaller modes of 1v1 duels or 2v2 brawls, and heroes for both players that want challenging learning curves with their heroes, or alternatively mindless fun (Looking at you, Ocelotl players). Lore was a bit of a mess in previous years, but year 8 is particularly promising with its lore as of year 8 season 3, as this season focuses on factions of knights, vikings, and samurai, instead of the covenants like Horkos and Chimera. I at the very least recommend trying the campaign, and maybe even just getting the game while it is on sale, such as when new heroes are released.

Bad Game.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
Genuinely, Ubisoft is a sad company.
This game was amazing when it first came amount, same thing for the first few seasons, but then they started added in these really fast characters that you cannot compete well with and then adding bleed to half of the fast characters that could already hit multiple times without the chance to block. Same idea for Rainbow 6 Siege.
Example, new Shaolin monk is such an easy character to play with all its lightining-fast attacks and attacks with lead into immediate heavy and light attacks.
Also, some heroes just don't have sweeping attacks? Like, that's fine, but why? It makes it impossible to play the center in Domination, especially with Centurion and Gladiator
Otherwise, ganking is the meta in multiplayer, do not try and watch people fight, just gank.

review: One of my most loved games I play even to this day. The combat is nothing like any other game I have played before and it's what keeps bringing me back in. Yes the game does have it's issues but for me the goods of the game outweigh the bads. The characters are Badass and the customization is awesome in my opinion. The newer characters have a lot of reused skins for higher rarity gear but just enough for me to be satisfied having it. huge learning curve in the very beginning but I recommend this game for people to try. Also remember "just parry" and you will do just fine

title: FOR HONOR
review:
A classic game with a solid community and has a really easy to learn but difficult to master type of combat.

If your into medieval PvP like Mordhaul or Sifu but it is Online-heavy, then this the game but more complex and somewhat addicting.

This game had their chance to shine and still could if they add an extra mini story quests alongside with the new characters. 

But all in all, I enjoy the game since it is heavily emphasize on having a "skill issue" instead of RNG

title: FOR HONOR
review:
Ah, For Honor. Or should I say For Torture? You know a game is great when you spend more time questioning your life choices than actually playing it. It's like they took the mechanics of combat, ran them through a blender, and dumped them out in the middle of a lag-ridden, glitch-filled wasteland where "honor" is something you’ll never experience.

The combat? Imagine trying to juggle three flaming swords while riding a unicycle. Blindfolded. That's about as intuitive as it gets. Who needs balance or skill when you can just get obliterated by a Viking with the hand-eye coordination of a potato?

And let’s talk about the online experience, which is basically a 50/50 gamble on whether you’ll be matched with an opponent or just a loading screen that lasts longer than your will to live. But when you do finally get into a game, you're welcomed by the soothing sounds of your teammates hurling insults at each other because, let’s be real, that’s the true "community spirit" here.

The story mode? I didn’t even know it had one until I accidentally clicked on it, and I wish I hadn’t. It’s like a rejected script for a knockoff Game of Thrones fanfiction, but with less coherence and more facepalming.

In conclusion, if you're a masochist who loves the sensation of repeatedly slamming your head into a brick wall while listening to prepubescent kids yell obscenities, For Honor is the game for you. For everyone else: save your time, save your money, and save your sanity.
10/10 would recommend

title: FOR HONOR
review:
the game has crashed nearly every game since I've started playing again after a year long break, it seems as though this game gets constant updates through battle passes and seasons with heroes every so often. However, the actually fundamental game stability is still abysmal. Despite having a decent time played in this game (including a couple hundred on Xbox), this is the time I want to play the game more than ever, but I'm having a lot of difficulty doing so due to numerous error codes kicking me out of games, in game lag (even against AI) and other issues I'm sure everyone else encounters too.

If you are looking to get into this game then I do suggest it as it is a lot of fun with a very dedicated player base but please expect a lot of gameplay stability issues and try to be a little more patient than me

title: FOR HONOR
review:
I started my journey with For Honor with the open beta and have followed it ever since. 

But MY GOD this game will drain your sanity. You will hate that you love this game. 

Never before have I played a game with such promise which is why it hurts that i feel the need to write this. 

Ill start off with the pros i guess: 
Great fighting SYSTEM (specifically the bones of this system)

Really cool universe and characters

That's about it.

Now, the negatives: 
Broken, buggy mess: Hits will sometimes not connect, or you will lag, or fall off a small piece of terrain, or not getting revenge when you should, or opponents getting revenge when they shouldnt, (this is vice versa btw, I've had BOTH ways)

Lack of effort: Every new hero released or patch dropped I find something to complain about. Whether it be buffs/nerfs that aren't needed, or just the fact they wont fix the broken revenge system, which has been broken for a very long time. Heros release with little to no cosmetics, and the ones they do release with are often just slightly changed from other versions. And you better be OK with wasting 20 hrs of your life to try and make them not look like hobos. Breach hasn't gotten a new map or any substantial changes in over 4 years, who does that? 

Teammates: This game will make you an introvert I swear. Never before have I played with such terrible players. It is quite literally like having small children playing your multiplayer game with you. Wether they have no patience and will feed revenge on someone you had no problem with, or they'll end up killing you in some way. They do not pay any sort of attention and will (most of the time) be an active detriment to your gameplay. Seriously, I'm not joking, out of 10 games you will be lucky to get 1-2 with ONE good teammate and sometimes even that doesn't happen. 

And Ubi needs to keep dropping new heroes because this game is losing players like a bucket full of holes and needs to squeeze every last cent out of this game before it crashes and burns which seems to be soon if the low player count in breach and the medium player count in dominion are anything to say and I for one can't wait till they put this game down and either come out with a new one that actually fixes this game's problems and turns it into the special beast I know it can be, but right now, this game is struggling, squirming in its death throes before its last gasp which i imagine will be coming with the next few heros. The devs have given their all, but its no match for the morbidly obese weight that Ubi likes to put on them. I thought I finally had a good fighting game to play all those years ago and to see it die like this hurts, hopefully it can rise from its ashes someday but I dont see it happening anytime soon.

title: FOR HONOR
review: I love graphics, characters and gameplay. Story is good because in story you fight as all 3 factions Knights, Vikings and Samurai.

The only remaining players in queue have played this game since it came out in 2017 and never stopped. I'd rather get actual malware than boot this game up again.

title: FOR HONOR
review: I played this game flawlessly through Xbox, however, trying to transfer my progress to Pc through Ubisoft is an absolute NIGHTMARE. Just in the past 3 hours I've had to uninstall and reinstall this game, just so my newly transferred account can be registered as the owner of this game that I just BOUGHT. Ubisoft Connect is an abolute joke, and it needs to be redone. Why is it that I can't play the game that I just bought through a different account because I started it on another?! Now instead of paying 5 dollars through Steam, I'm now having to pay FULL PRICE just so I can play this damn game through another service. Fuck Ubisoft

I mean... it was free on the loser game store and I still barely played it.

Full of sweats. Too late to get into this game now unless you play with friends alone.

Chivarly is better. This game is a 3D fighting game but Soul Caliber does fighting better. It's like it tried to be Soul Caliber and Chivarly and ended up failing at both. Nothing like slashing someone 10 times before they die... Total realism.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
My favorite fighting game that everyone likes to pretend is not a fighting game. Honestly for how much we all like to hate For Honor, this game is addicting as crack, and as fun as crack; and there really is no substitute for it. 

The combat is like if you took Street Fighter into a 3D plane, the gameplay is fluid and combos are smooth; no other game can really compare.

Also, I love Centurion so much I can't even express it with words. I only picked up this game for him.

title: FOR HONOR
review: If this game had good servers it would be fine. But when you get 4 critical error connections in a row just trying to play it just sucks the fun right out of the game. I have good internet and solid connection but it never fails to just boot me out every damn day.

title: FOR HONOR
review: very slept on, has a learning curve but is very fun. got a couple friends to start playing with me and now its their main game as of the last 3 weeks

title: FOR HONOR
review:
[h3] For Stinky [/h3]

Used to be reaction-based fighting game to prediction based 50-50 guessmania. 
They started adding DLC characters years ago that worked like that, that then dominated the game, until they thought "Fuck it, give everyone 50-50s". And now all characters play the same.
[b] Get into your 50-50 setup -> hit -> wait for stamina -> repeat [/b]
You get about 50 coins for a duel. Buying an effect costs 5000 coins. You have to buy it separately for [1.] Your executions, [2.] Idle Emote, [3.] Free roam emote, [4.] Combat Emote.
Enjoy playing (20.000/50=) 400 duels, just to have some stock unity wind effects swirl around you (or buy the same amount of coins for 20€! Get the battle pass too while you're at it, oy vey!!)

Very boring. Very grindy. Everyone is angry. Ranked matches have been in Beta for at least 4 years, and half of all gamemodes are dead and deserted.
Would not recommend

title: FOR HONOR
review: I started playing for honor in the open beta great game felt in love with the combat the graphics are good and its just a fun fighting game but thats the only good things. For the bad things, first newcomers there is no way for people that want to give this game a try because this game has a big learning curve and most of the people i tried to get on for honor just fell behind because they got matched against people that are already good thats for most matches so newcomers have no way to learn the basics so they just quit reason: they find the mechanics unforgiving and lose intrest to learn them, yes there is a training arena or tutorial but those teach you only inputs in my opinion. Second problem as for rainbow six seige to unlock a new character it takes to much time yes they give you some characters for starting out based on your faction but you will only own 3 normal characters the other from the faction are just there you can play but you cant customise them or anything and the 3 base characters are really boring. Third problem broken mechanics this game has many mechanics that are just unfair in many scenarios like for example light spam, gladiator toe stab, centurions punches these mechanics just make some characters broken and some too weak to play but i get this is a problem that cant be changes because its a fighting game where every single character has different mechanics they cant be all perfectly balanced. Fourth problem the servers ubisoft doesnt give a fuck about games so they also dont care to make good servers if someone in the game has a minor lag it will result in the match cancel kicking all players mid game or just individuals. Fifth problem i hate micro transactions so for a game of a money hungry company like ubisoft what do you expect so many skins, battlepass, in game currency to buy cosmetics but it has a bright side to  it you can get this things for free but you have to grind so much that the games fun is drained out of it. For my opinion good game but has many problems that you can get around its up to you.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
Ubi account with two factor got hacked. Ubi said they cant do anything. Going through a process with a third party to retrieve my account and its 50/50 if i get it back. Fuck you ubi you are absolute trash

I got my account back after 3 weeks... Took a long time, I submitted 3 different requests AND if i wrote all the stupid sht ubi did (like sending me the same email over and over after I respond to it) this would be a essay. Game is fun but ubi is trash so this review will stay even though ill still play and enjoy the game

review:
Yes i would recommend this game if you really want to lose it at your friends/randoms for feeding revenge in every fight you get into.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
It's trendy to hate the game ironically.
Usually saying that is a cope but I swear only half a percent of the NEGATIVE reviews raise valid issues like a rough (understatement) learning curve, poor server maintenance, situational problems related to optimisation and Ubisoft's practices as a company. The rest are complaints about the game being good and have hundreds if not thousands of logged hours. I want to remind you these are the negative reviews.
But fuck it, if you're reading this review then you either know me personally or can make this observation for yourselves. 

This game slaps, I sincerely feel the Devs' respect for the players and believe it's honestly worth being cringe for a sec, dropping the memes and acknowledging this rare example of a AAA publisher allowing a title to do something different and still as relevant as it is after 7 years.

Enough boot licking though, I was too scared to try any other hero till my warden hit rep 50 and this game has done longterm damage to my mental health. Would recommend.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
Instead of raising the skill-ceiling - they raised the "predict the future" or "roll the dice" ceiling. (some would call it "reading your enemy" - that's BS - there is no telegraphing, only 50/50 or 30/60 guesses) 

What is Ubisoft even doing? Do they even play their own games?

title: FOR HONOR
review: Terribly unbalanced. Insanely high skill ceiling. Your MS/Ping matter as much in this game as watching Pixels in Rainbow 6 Siege. The roughly 5000 Steam Players who rotate on this game daily are all being held at gun point.

title: FOR HONOR
review: Story mode's good, fun with friends, but never solo queue for your own sanity

title: FOR HONOR
review: Even using through Steam you are still required to use a ubisoft connect account. I have used an old account used by me and another family member back on ps4, thinking it would transfer over. After seeing nothing made it over and instead logged me into their own For Honor account I made my own account and tried to transfer ownsership of the game to it to no avail nor help from ubisoft support. i have spent only so long in my family members account that they said I could use since they were no longer going to play this trainwreck of a game, until an update to ubisoft connect logged me out, and now if I open for honor I only get a ubisoft connect window that says it has trouble verifying ownsership, with a Support button that does nothing when clicked. Do not get this game.

title: FOR HONOR
review:
It'd be great if the only active players weren't day one addicts or psychotically competitive toxic sweat-lords. But alas, this is not newcomer friendly in the slightest and 90% of the players you'll come across will just relentlessly spam the same attack until they either win or you quit. AND if you thought they'd allow forfeitures or backing out, boy are you wrong. If you leave a match, get ready for 15 minutes per rage induced menu spam (it will happen, and you will try to break your chosen input)

This game is bricked, don't play unless you hate yourself and everyone who might live near you
